verses.verse: Now it happened in the <S%H702>fourteenth<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> of <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H2396>Hezekiah,<s%> that <S%H5576>Sennacherib<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria<s%> <S%H5927>attacked<s%> all of the <S%H1219>fortified<s%> <S%H5892>cities<s%> of <S%H3063>Judah,<s%> and captured <S%H8610>them.<s%>

The <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria<s%> <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H7262>Rabshakeh<s%> from <S%H3923>Lachish<s%> to <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> to <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H2396>Hezekiah<s%> with a <S%H3515>large<s%> <S%H2426>army.<s%> He <S%H5975>stood<s%> by the <S%H8585>aqueduct<s%> from the <S%H5945>upper<s%> <S%H1295>pool<s%> in the <S%H3526>fuller<s%>'s <S%H7704>field<s%> <S%H4546>highway.<s%>

Then <S%H471>Eliakim<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H2518>Hilkiah,<s%> who was over the <S%H1004>household,<s%> and <S%H7644>Shebna<s%> the <S%H5608>scribe,<s%> and <S%H3098>Joah,<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H623>Asaph,<s%> the <S%H2142>recorder<s%> came out to <S%H3318>him.<s%>

<S%H7262>Rabshakeh<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H559>them,<s%> "Now tell <S%H2396>Hezekiah,<s%> <S%H559><s%> 'Thus says the <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H4428>king,<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria,<s%> "What <S%H986>confidence<s%> is this in which you <S%H986>trust?<s%>

I <S%H559>say<s%> that your <S%H6098>counsel<s%> and <S%H1369>strength<s%> for the <S%H4421>war<s%> are only <S%H8193>vain<s%> <S%H1697>words.<s%> Now in whom do you <S%H982>trust,<s%> that you have rebelled against <S%H4775>me?<s%>

<S%H982>Behold,<s%> you trust in the <S%H4938>staff<s%> of this <S%H7533>bruised<s%> <S%H7070>reed,<s%> even in <S%H4714>Egypt,<s%> which if a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H5564>leans<s%> on <S%H935>it,<s%> it will go into his <S%H3709>hand<s%> and <S%H5344>pierce<s%> <S%H6547>it.<s%> So is Pharaoh <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%> to all who trust in <S%H982>him.<s%>

But if you <S%H559>tell<s%> <S%H982>me,<s%> 'We trust in <S%H3068>Yahweh<s%> our <S%H430>God,<s%>' <S%H1116>isn't<s%> that he whose high places and whose <S%H4196>altars<s%> <S%H2396>Hezekiah<s%> has taken <S%H5493>away,<s%> and has <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H3063>Judah<s%> and to <S%H3389>Jerusalem,<s%> <S%H7812><s%> 'You shall worship <S%H6440>before<s%> this <S%H4196>altar?<s%>'"

Now <S%H6148>therefore,<s%> please make a pledge to my <S%H113>master<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria,<s%> and I will <S%H5414>give<s%> you two <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H5483>horses,<s%> if you are <S%H3201>able<s%> on your part to <S%H5414>set<s%> riders on <S%H7392>them.<s%>

How then can you turn <S%H7725>away<s%> the <S%H6440>face<s%> of <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H6346>captain<s%> of the <S%H6996>least<s%> of my <S%H113>master<s%>'s <S%H5650>servants,<s%> and put your <S%H982>trust<s%> on <S%H4714>Egypt<s%> for <S%H7393>chariots<s%> and for <S%H6571>horsemen?<s%>

Have I come <S%H5927>up<s%> now <S%H1107>without<s%> <S%H3068>Yahweh<s%> against this <S%H776>land<s%> to <S%H7843>destroy<s%> <S%H3068>it?<s%> Yahweh <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H5927>me,<s%> "Go up against this <S%H776>land,<s%> and destroy <S%H7843>it.<s%>"'"

Then <S%H471>Eliakim,<s%> <S%H7644>Shebna<s%> and <S%H3098>Joah<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H7262>Rabshakeh,<s%> "Please <S%H1696>speak<s%> to your <S%H5650>servants<s%> in <S%H762>Aramaic,<s%> for we <S%H8085>understand<s%> <S%H1696>it;<s%> and don't speak to us in the <S%H3066>Jews<s%>' language in the <S%H241>hearing<s%> of the <S%H5971>people<s%> who are on the <S%H2346>wall.<s%>"

But <S%H7262>Rabshakeh<s%> <S%H559>said,<s%> "Has my <S%H113>master<s%> <S%H7971>sent<s%> me only to your <S%H113>master<s%> and to <S%H1696>you,<s%> to speak these <S%H1697>words,<s%> and not to the <S%H582>men<s%> who <S%H3427>sit<s%> on the <S%H2346>wall,<s%> who will <S%H398>eat<s%> their own <S%H2716>dung<s%> and <S%H8354>drink<s%> their own urine with <S%H7272>you?<s%>"

Then <S%H7262>Rabshakeh<s%> <S%H5975>stood,<s%> and <S%H7121>called<s%> out with a <S%H1419>loud<s%> <S%H6963>voice<s%> in the <S%H3066>Jews<s%>' language, and <S%H559>said,<s%> <S%H8085>"Hear<s%> the <S%H1697>words<s%> of the <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H4428>king,<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria!<s%>
Thus <S%H559>says<s%> the <S%H4428>king,<s%> <S%H2396><s%> 'Don't let Hezekiah <S%H5377>deceive<s%> <S%H3201>you;<s%> for he will not be able to deliver <S%H5337>you.<s%>

<S%H2396>Don't<s%> let Hezekiah make you <S%H982>trust<s%> in <S%H3068>Yahweh,<s%> <S%H559>saying,<s%> <S%H3068>"Yahweh<s%> will <S%H5337>surely<s%> <S%H5337>deliver<s%> <S%H5892>us.<s%> This city <S%H5414>won't<s%> be given into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria.<s%>"'

<S%H8085>Don't<s%> listen to <S%H2396>Hezekiah,<s%> for thus <S%H559>says<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria,<s%> <S%H6213><s%> 'Make your <S%H1293>peace<s%> with <S%H3318>me,<s%> and come out to <S%H376>me;<s%> and each of you <S%H398>eat<s%> from his <S%H1612>vine,<s%> and each <S%H376>one<s%> from his fig <S%H8384>tree,<s%> and each <S%H376>one<s%> of you <S%H8354>drink<s%> the <S%H4325>waters<s%> of his own <S%H953>cistern;<s%>

until I <S%H935>come<s%> and take you <S%H3947>away<s%> to a <S%H776>land<s%> like your own <S%H776>land,<s%> a <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H1715>grain<s%> and new <S%H8492>wine,<s%> a <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H3899>bread<s%> and <S%H3754>vineyards.<s%>

Beware lest <S%H2396>Hezekiah<s%> <S%H5496>persuade<s%> <S%H559>you,<s%> saying, <S%H3068>"Yahweh<s%> will <S%H5337>deliver<s%> <S%H376>us.<s%>" Have any of the <S%H430>gods<s%> of the <S%H1471>nations<s%> <S%H5337>delivered<s%> their <S%H776>lands<s%> from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H804>Assyria?<s%>

Where are the <S%H430>gods<s%> of <S%H2574>Hamath<s%> and <S%H774>Arpad?<s%> Where are the <S%H430>gods<s%> of <S%H5617>Sepharvaim?<s%> Have they <S%H5337>delivered<s%> <S%H8111>Samaria<s%> from my <S%H3027>hand?<s%>

Who are they among all the <S%H430>gods<s%> of these <S%H776>countries<s%> that have <S%H5337>delivered<s%> their <S%H776>country<s%> out of my <S%H3027>hand,<s%> that <S%H3068>Yahweh<s%> should <S%H5337>deliver<s%> <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> out of my <S%H3027>hand?<s%>'"
But they remained <S%H2790>silent,<s%> and <S%H6030>said<s%> <S%H1697>nothing<s%> in <S%H4428>reply,<s%> for the king's <S%H4687>commandment<s%> <S%H559>was,<s%> <S%H1697>"Don't<s%> answer him."

Then <S%H471>Eliakim<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H2518>Hilkiah,<s%> who was over the <S%H1004>household,<s%> and <S%H7644>Shebna<s%> the <S%H5608>scribe,<s%> and <S%H3098>Joah,<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H623>Asaph,<s%> the <S%H2142>recorder,<s%> <S%H935>came<s%> to <S%H2396>Hezekiah<s%> with their <S%H899>clothes<s%> <S%H7167>torn,<s%> and <S%H5046>told<s%> him the <S%H1697>words<s%> of <S%H7262>Rabshakeh.<s%>
